Description: TikTok is flooded by a surge of fake cryptocurrency giveaways posted to the video-sharing platform, with almost all of the videos pretending to be themes based on Elon Musk, Tesla, or SpaceX.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang claims to have hacked the Italian branch of the TÜV SÜD international service corporation.

Author: Earth Lusca
Target: Multiple organizations in the government, technology, and telecommunications sectors
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that a Chinese espionage-focused hacker tracked as 'Earth Lusca' was observed targeting government agencies in multiple countries, using a new Linux backdoor dubbed 'SprySOCKS.'

Author: APT36 AKA Transparent Tribe, Mythic Leopard
Target: Military or diplomacy in India and Pakistan
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One reveal that the suspected Pakistani threat actor APT36, known as 'Transparent Tribe,' has been observed using at least three Android apps that mimic YouTube to infect devices with their signature remote access trojan dubbed 'CapraRAT.'
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The City of Pittsburg is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2021-3129, a Laravel Ignition vulnerability, to the list of the known exploited vulnerabilities.
The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2017-6884, a Zyxel vulnerability, to the list of the known exploited vulnerabilities.
The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2014-8361, a Realtek vulnerability, to the list of the known exploited vulnerabilities.
The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2022-22265 , a Samsung vulnerability, to the list of the known exploited vulnerabilities.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Ministry of Finance of Kuwait is hit by a cyber attack. The Rhysida ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Sophos discover a new ‘pig butchering’ cryptocurrency scam campaign, stealing more than $1m to the victims in three months.

Author: Hafnium
Target: E-commerce sites in North and Latin America
Description: Researchers from Blackberry discover 'Silent Skimmer', a web skimming campaign carried out by the Chinese threat actor Hafnium, and targeting e-commerce sites in North and Latin America.

Author: Threat actors from Indonesia
Description: Researchers from Sysdig discover AMBERSQUID, a cloud-native cryptojacking operation targeting uncommon Amazon Web Services (AWS) services such as AWS Amplify, AWS Fargate, and Amazon SageMaker to illicitly mine cryptocurrency.

Author: 8BASE
Description: The 8BASE ransomware gang lists the Brazilian law firm Araújo e Policastro Advogados among their victims.

Target: Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services
Description: The Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS) files a notice of data breach.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Municipality of Betton suffers a Medusa ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: ThreeAM (AKA 3AM)
Description: Visiting Physician’s Network (VPN) is added to the list of the ThreeAM ransomware group.

Author: ShroudedSnooper
Target: Telecommunication service providers in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover two new malware strains named HTTPSnoop and PipeSnoop, used in cyberattacks on telecommunication service providers in the Middle East.
The International Criminal Court (ICC) discloses a cyberattack after discovering that its systems had been breached during the previous week.
Trend Micro fixes CVE-2023-41179, a remote code execution zero-day vulnerability in the Trend Micro's Apex One endpoint protection solution, actively exploited in attacks.

Target: Users of the crypto lender Celsius
Description: Scammers are impersonating Stretto, the bankruptcy claim agent for crypto lender Celsius in phishing attacks that attempt to steal funds from cryptocurrency wallets.

Author: whalersplonk
Target: Other cyber criminals or security researchers
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that an attacker is spreading a fake proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2023-40477, a recently fixed WinRAR vulnerability on GitHub, attempting to infect downloaders with the VenomRAT malware.
Researchers from Sonatype and Phylum discover a stream of malicious npm and PyPi packages stealing a wide range of sensitive data from software developers on the platforms.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) is hit with a DDoS attack. The Pro-Russia collective NoName057(16) claims responsibility for the attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Canadian Air Transport Security Authority is hit with a DDoS attack. The Pro-Russia collective NoName057(16) claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: Some Government institutions in Canada are hit with a DDoS attack. The Pro-Russia collective NoName057(16) claims responsibility for the attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: Some Financial institutions in Canada are hit with a DDoS attack. The Pro-Russia collective NoName057(16) claims responsibility for the attack.
The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2023-28434, a MinIO vulnerability, to the list of the known exploited vulnerabilities.
In its annual report with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Campbell Soup says it discovered a cyber intrusion in part of its IT network.

Author: TAG-74
Target: South Korean academic, political, and government organizations
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future discover a "multi-year" Chinese state-sponsored cyber espionage campaign targeting South Korean academic, political, and government organizations.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Checkmarx discover a malicious Python package, “Culturestreak”, able to hijack system resources for unauthorized cryptocurrency mining.

Author: XWorm
Description: Researchers at Any.run discover a new version of the XWorm malware.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: St. Luke’s Health System issues a notice saying that it had been notified by Nuance of the MOVEit breach, affecting 4,679 of their patients.
The Kfar Shaul Mental Health Center and the Eitanim psychiatric hospital, both part of Jerusalem Mental Health Center, are hit with a cyber attack.

Author: USDoD
Description: Credit reporting firm TransUnion denies claims of a security breach after a threat actor known as USDoD leaked data allegedly stolen from the company's network.

Author: P2PInfect
Target: Multiple organizations in China, the United States, Germany, the United Kingdom, Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan
Description: Researchers from Cado Security discover a 600x increase in malicious traffic by the  P2Pinfect botnet.
Country: CN DE JP HK SG US

Description: Air Canada discloses a cyber security incident in which hackers "briefly" obtained limited access to its internal systems.

Author: Snatch
Target: Organizations in the agriculture, IT and defense industries in the U.S.
Description: The FBI and Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) publish a warning on the activities of the Snatch ransomware gang targeting organizations in the agriculture, IT and defense industries in the U.S.
The social media account of the former US President's son is apparently hacked and publishes some offensive posts, including that his dad had passed away.
Bungie reveals hat the login problems that hit Destiny 2 players over the weekend were actually due to a DDoS attack that slowed down the service.

Author: LUCR-3 (overlapping with Scattered Spider, Oktapus, UNC3944, and STORM-0875)
Target: Fortune 2000 companies across various sectors, including Software, Retail, Hospitality, Manufacturing, and Telecoms.
Description: Researchers from Permiso reveal the details of LUCR-3, a threat actor overlapping with Scattered Spider, Oktapus, UNC3944, and STORM-0875, targeting Fortune 2000 companies in different verticals.

Target: Banking users in Mexico and Brazil
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new campaign targeting Banking users in Mexico and Brazil through a variant of the BBTok malware.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Lakeland Community College notifies 290,000 people of a data breach that may have compromised their personal, financial and health information. The Vice Society ransomware group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Police in SIngapore issues an advisory about a new Android scam, where attackers would initiate a factory reset on the infected devices after the malware executes unauthorised transactions on the phone’s i-banking app.

Author: U.S.
Description: China's Ministry of State Security (MSS) accuses the U.S. of breaking into Huawei's servers, stealing critical data, and implanting backdoors since 2009.

Researchers from Proofpoint discover multiple campaigns targeting Chinese-language speakers. and distributing various malware families such as Sainbox RAT, Purple Fox, and a new trojan called ValleyRAT.

Author: Cyber Avengers
Description: The pro-Iranian Cyber Avengers hacktivist group claims to have hit the Israeli Railways, supposedly revealing information about the electrical infrastructure of the country's railroad network.

Author: Gold Melody (AKA UNC961 and Prophet Spider)
Description: Researchers from Secureworks reveal the details of Gold Melody, a financially motivated threat actor using known vulnerabilities, ordinary TTPs, and off-the-shelf tools to exploit unpatched servers.
BMO Bank files a notice of data breach after discovering that information entrusted to the company was accessible to an unauthorized party.
Crown Point Community School reveals to have been the victim of a ransomware attack costing $1M to resolve.

Balancer, an ethereum-based automated market maker, on suffers a security breach that resulted in a loss of $238,000, attributing the compromise to a social engineering attack on the domain registrar EuroDNS.
Apple releases emergency security updates to patch CVE-2023-41991, CVE-2023-41992, and CVE-2023-41993, three new zero-day vulnerabilities exploited in attacks targeting iPhone and Mac users.

Author: Sandman
Target: Telecommunication service providers in the Middle East, Western Europe, and South Asia
Description: Researchers from SentinelOne and QGroup GmbH discover a previously unknown threat actor dubbed 'Sandman' targeting telecommunication service providers in the Middle East, Western Europe, and South Asia, using a modular info-stealing malware named 'LuaDream.'

Author: Russian threat actors
Description: The Government of British overseas territory Bermuda has linked a cyberattack affecting all its departments' IT systems since Thursday to hackers based out of Russia.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Marymount Manhattan College (MMC) if forced to invest $3.5 million in cybersecurity after a breach affecting 200,000 individuals following a ransomware attack.
The Auckland University of Technology is hit with a Monti ransomware attack.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Progressive Leasing discloses a ransomware attack. The ALPHV ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
The Fort Lauderdale Police Department investigates a financial fraud incident involving the City of Fort Lauderdale, which lost $1.2 million dollars in a phishing scam.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: APT29
Description: Researchers from Mandiant and Google’s Threat Analysis Group (TAG) reveal an increase in the frequency and scope of APT29 phishing operations centered on foreign embassies in Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Customers of hotels, booking sites, and travel agents
Description: Researchers from Akamai discover an infostealer campaign targeting customers of hotels, booking sites, and travel agents.

Author: APT34, AKA OilRig, Cobalt Gypsy, IRN2 and Helix Kitten
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Outer Space, a campaign carried out by the Iranian threat actor APT34 targeting organizations in Israel during 2021.

Author: APT34, AKA OilRig, Cobalt Gypsy, IRN2 and Helix Kitten
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Juicy Mix, a campaign carried out by the Iranian threat actor APT34 targeting organizations in Israel during 2022.

Author: HiddenGh0st
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover HiddenGh0st, a variant of the Gh0st RAT, distributing the Hidden rootkit and targeting poorly managed MS-SQL servers, and designed to conceal its presence and steal sensitive information.
More than 2 million Pakistani citizens are facing risk of data leak as attackers get access to a private company-made database used by hundreds of restaurants.
Frax Outsourcing files a notice of data breach after determining that it was the recent victim of a cyberattack.

T-Mobile denies suffering another data breach following reports that a threat actor dubbed 'emo' leaked a large database (89 GB ZIP archive) allegedly containing T-Mobile employees’ data, pointing the finger to an authorized retailer.
Ethereum blockchain analytics firm Nansen asks a subset of its users to reset passwords following a recent data breach at its authentication provider.

Security researchers with the Citizen Lab and Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) reveal that three zero-days vulnerabilities patched by Apple (CVE-2023-41991, CVE-2023-41992, and CVE-2023-41993) were abused as part of an exploit chain to install Cytrox's Predator spyware to target former Egyptian MP Ahmed Eltantawy.

Author: Gelsemium
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto discover a new campaign by the advanced persistent threat (APT) tracked as Gelsemium targeting a Southeast Asian government.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Stealth Falcon (aka Project Raven or FruityArmor)
Target: Government agency in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a novel and sophisticated backdoor malware named 'Deadglyph' used in a cyberespionage attack against a government agency in the Middle East by the Stealth Falcon APT, a state-sponsored group from the United Arab Emirates (UAE).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Medusa
Description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth), the government organization that manages the universal healthcare system of the Philippines, discovers an information security incident. The Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Crimean authorities reveal that their entire internet infrastructure is taken down, causing outages on the peninsula, with multiple Internet providers affected at once.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Financial Institution Service files a notice of data breach after discovering that the vulnerability in the file-transfer application MOVEit allowed attackers to access the personal information of more than 750,000 people.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Johnson Financial Group files a notice of data breach after discovering that the vulnerability in the file-transfer application MOVEit allowed attackers to access the personal information of more than 750,000 people.
The Hong Kong Consumer Council is hit with a ransomware attack. 25,000 individuals are affected.

Author: EvilBamboo (formerly named Evil Eye)
Target: Tibetan, Uyghur, and Taiwanese individuals and organizations
Description: Researchers from Volexity discover several long-running and currently active campaigns undertaken by the Chinese threat actor tracked as EvilBamboo (formerly named Evil Eye) targeting Tibetan, Uyghur, and Taiwanese individuals and organizations.

Author: Stately Taurus (AKA Mustang Panda)
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a cluster of malicious cyber espionage activities (tracked as CL-STA-0044), attributed to the well-known Chinese group Stately Taurus (AKA Mustang Panda), targeting Governmental entities in Southeast Asia.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Alloy Taurus (AKA GALLIUM)
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a cluster of malicious cyber espionage activities (tracked as CL-STA-0045), attributed to the well-known Chinese group Alloy Taurus (AKA GALLIUM), targeting Governmental entities in Southeast Asia.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: OrthoAlaska files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential information that had been entrusted to the company was subject to unauthorized access.
LCS Financial Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that hackers were able to access the company’s computer system.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files another notice of data breach on behalf of UBS Financial Services affected by a data breach at Sovos involving the MOVEit file transfer application.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files another notice of data breach on behalf of Atlantic Shareholder Services affected by a data breach at Sovos involving the MOVEit file transfer application.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files another notice of data breach on behalf of Patelco Credit Union affected by a data breach at Sovos involving the MOVEit file transfer application.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files another notice of data breach on behalf of Bangor Savings Bank affected by a data breach at Sovos involving the MOVEit file transfer application.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files another notice of data breach on behalf of Pan-American Life Insurance Group affected by a data breach at Sovos involving the MOVEit file transfer application.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files another notice of data breach on behalf of Celink affected by a data breach at Sovos involving the MOVEit file transfer application.
Researchers from Group-IB discover a hidden cryptojacking campaign on an online thesaurus with more than five million visits per month, distributing the XMRig Coinminer.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Pain Care Specialists are the victim of a ransomware attack by BlackCat/AlphV. The threat actors add the medical entity to their leak sit. with some files with personal information on employees and patients, part of an alleged 150GB of data stolen.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The NoEscape ransomware gang lists Mulkay Cardiology Consultants to their leak site, claiming to have stolen 60GB of data on more than 30,000 patients.

Target: Broomfield Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Center
Description: Broomfield Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Center reaches an agreement for a March 2021 data breach, when t two employee email accounts were compromised.
AIDS Alabama discovers that an unauthorized third party accessed its network and starts notifying the affected patients.

Navvis & Company, a provider of health management services to healthcare organizations, provides notice of a recent data privacy event that may have affected the personal and protected health information related to certain individuals.
A third-party security incident may have reportedly exposed user information of NFT marketplace OpenSea, including API keys.
TikTok is flooded with videos promoting fake nude celebrity photo leaks used to push referral rewards for the Temu online megastore.

Target: Cook County Health and Hospitals System
Description: Cook County Health and Hospitals System (CCH) notifies a data breach involving an external vendor, Perry Johnson & Associates (PJ&A), previously providing medical transcription services for CCH.

Mixin Network, an open-source, peer-to-peer transactional network for digital assets, announces that deposits and withdrawals are suspended effective immediately due to a $200 million hack the platform suffered.

Author: Xenomorph
Target: Android users in the United States, Canada, Spain, Italy, Portugal, and Belgium
Description: Security researchers from ThreatFabric discover a new campaign distributing a new version of the Xenomorph malware to Android users in the United States, Canada, Spain, Italy, Portugal, and Belgium.
Country: BE CA ES IT PT US

Description: Researchers from Dr.Web reveal that threat actors are actively exploiting CVE-2023-32315, a high-severity vulnerability in Openfire messaging servers to encrypt servers with ransomware and deploy cryptominers.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: The Hospital for Sick Children, more commonly known as SickKids, discloses to be among the healthcare providers impacted by the recent breach at BORN Ontario.

Author: AtlasCross
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS discover a new APT group named 'AtlasCross' targeting organizations with two previously undocumented trojans, DangerAds and AtlasAgent, and using phishing lures impersonating the American Red Cross to deliver backdoor malware.

Author: Akira
Description: KNP Logistics, described as one of the United Kingdom’s largest privately owned logistics groups, declares itself insolvent, blaming a ransomware attack, claimed by the Akira group, back in June.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang adds Phil-Data Business Systems to the list of its victims.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang adds Clarion to the list of its victims.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang adds MNGI Digestive Health to the list of its victims.

Author: Smishing Triad
Description: Researchers from Resecurity discover a new campaign by the ‘Smishing Triad’ cybercrime group expanding its actions into the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

Author: UAC-0154
Description: Researchers from Securonix discover STARK#VORTEX, a campaign actively targeting Ukraine’s military with malware-laced lure files themed as UAVs service manuals delivering the MerlinAgent payload.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Date Occurred: Since at least end of August 2023
Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a social engineering campaign targeting the hospitality sector and deploying five different information stealer malware, such as RedLine Stealer, Vidar Stealer, Stealc, Lumma Stealer and Spidey Bot.
Francesca’s Acquisition files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed portions of its computer network.
Attackers steal $7.9 million from crypto exchange HTX, but the company "resolved all related issues" as it has "fully covered the losses incurred from the attack.

Author: ADHD
Description: The hacktivist group ADHD claims to have hacked the Union of Lawyers in Lombardy (Camera Penale della Lombardia) and leaks some data.
LastPass customers report a pervasive and convincing global phishing campaign targeting a variety of sectors, including 87 of our employees.

Author: ShadowSyndicate
Description: Researchers from Group-IB identify the infrastructure belonging to a threat actor tracked as ShadowSyndicate, who likely deployed seven different ransomware families in attacks over the past year.

Author: RansomedVC or MajorNelson?
Description: Sony it is investigating allegations of a cyberattack as different hackers have stepped up to claim responsibility for the purported hack and the subsequent leak of 3.14 GB of data.
Threat actors are using a new trick of using zero-point fonts in emails to make malicious emails appear as safely scanned by security tools in Microsoft Outlook.

Author: Dark Angels
Description: Johnson Controls International suffers a massive ransomware attack that encrypts many of the company devices, including VMware ESXi servers, impacting the company’s and its subsidiaries’ operations.
Researchers from Proofpoint identify a new malware called ZenRAT being distributed via fake installation packages of the password manager Bitwarden.

Author: Threat actors from Russia
Target: Ukraine's prosecutor general's office, courts, and other entities involved in investigating war crimes
Description: The Ukraine's cybersecurity service (SSSCIP) reveal the details of a recent cyber espionage campaigns targeting Ukraine's prosecutor general's office, courts, and other entities involved in investigating war crimes.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Phylum unearth several malicious packages on npm and PyPI repositories, designed to steal a wide range of sensitive data from developers.

Author: RansomedVC
Description: In a development following the recent data leak from Sony, the notorious ransomware syndicate Ransomed.vc targets Japan’s largest telecommunication giant, NTT Docomo.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: West Virginia University Health System posts a website notice informing patients of a third-party data breach involving an incident that occurred at Nuance Communications exploiting the MOVEit vulnerability.
Community First Medical Center (CFMC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed the company’s computer system.
The Maries County Courthouse announces to have been hit by a cyberattack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Rhysida ransomware gang leaks some data from the Istituto Prosperius.

Author: Lu0Bot
Description: Researchers from Any.run discover Lu0Bot, a malware written in Node.js.

Researchers from Checkmarx, discover that threat actors are breaching GitHub accounts and inserting malicious code disguised as Dependabot contributions to steal authentication secrets and passwords from developers.

Author: BlackTech (AKA Palmerworm, Circuit Panda, and Radio Panda)
Description: The United States National Security Agency (NSA), the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), the Japan National Police Agency (NPA), and the Japan National Center of Incident Readiness and Strategy for Cybersecurity (NISC) warn of the Chinese 'BlackTech' threat actors breaching network devices to install custom backdoors for access to corporate networks.
Google patches CVE-2023-5217, the fifth Chrome zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks since the start of the year in emergency security updates released today.
Cisco warns to patch CVE-2023-20109, a zero-day IOS and IOS XE software vulnerability targeted by attackers in the wild.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The FBI warns about a new trend in ransomware attacks where multiple strains are deployed on victims' networks to encrypt systems in under two days.
The European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI) reveals that threat actors have stolen a database identifying its users.

Author: CACTUS
Description: The CACTUS ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Astro Lighting, a supplier of bathroom lightning in the U.K.

Author: CACTUS
Description: The CACTUS ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Orthum Bau, a construction company in Germany.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a malicious campaign exploiting the tensions between Azerbaijan and Armenia.
PHH Mortgage Corporation files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access information that had been provided to the company.
Mountrail County Medical Center is affected by a cybersecurity incident at its imaging vendor, DMS Health Technologies.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Erlanger Health is also affected by the MOVEit hack at Nuance Communications.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Arkansas Total Care member is also stolen from Ricoh USA, Inc. after the MOVEit Transfer vulnerability was exploited.

UK charities including Shelter, the RSPCA, the Dogs Trust, Battersea Dogs and Cats Home, and Friends of the Earth warn their supporters that hackers have stolen their data following a breach at Kokoro, a supplier of the charities.
Baruch College is hit with a malware attack.

ChildFund in New Zealand issues a public notice about a data breach involving a telemarketing company, Pareto Phone Limited. ChildFund had contracted with Pareto in 2014 to conduct fundraising activity on its behalf.

Author: Lost Trust
Description: Lost Trust Team adds GI Medical Services in New York to a new leak site.

Author: URSNIF
Description: The Italian National CERT (CERT-AgID) reveals the details of a new campaign, in theme with the National Revenue Agency (Agenzia delle Entrate), delivering the URSNIF malware.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims to have hacked Acoustic Center, an Italian regional company for the distribution of hearing systems.

Author: Indian Cyber Force
Description: The Indian Cyber Force claims responsibility for a cyberattack that takes down the website of the Canadian Armed Forces.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Budworn (aka APT27 or Emissary Panda)
Target: Telecommunication firm in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from Symantec/Broadcom observe the Chinese cyber-espionage group tracked as Budworm targeting a telecommunication firm in the Middle East and a government entity in Asia using a new variant of its custom 'SysUpdate' backdoor.

Author: Budworn (aka APT27 or Emissary Panda)
Description: Researchers from Symantec/Broadcom observe the Chinese cyber-espionage group tracked as Budworm targeting a telecommunication firm in the Middle East and a government entity in Asia using a new variant of its custom 'SysUpdate' backdoor.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2018-14667, a Red Hat vulnerability, to the list of the known exploited vulnerabilities.

Author: Ukrainian IT Army
Description: Leonardo, the Russian flight booking system is hit by a DDoS attack, allegedly carried out by "foreign hackers,"
Mt. Graham Regional Medical Center (MGRMC) investigates a cybersecurity incident that is affecting its communication and information systems.

Author: Zanubis
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a new campaign distributing the Android banking Trojan Zanubis in disguise of the official app for the Peruvian governmental organization SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administración Tributaria).

Author: ASMCrypt
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover ASMCrypt, a new crypter and loader as-a-service, described as an "evolved version" of another loader malware known as DoubleFinger.

Target: Pinal County School Office Data Processing Service Consortium was the victim of a ransomware attack
Description: The Pinal County School Office Data Processing Service Consortium confirms to have been hit by a ransomware attack.
Researchers from DomainTools observe an uptick in smishing and phishing campaigns targeting the US Postal Service (USPS).
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign exploiting Bing Chat, Bing’s AI chatbot, to serve malware.
Researchers from Avanan discover a campaign distributing phishing pages via Dropbox.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Arietis Health is added to the list of entities affected by the MOVEit breach. 1,975,066 individuals are affected.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims to have hacked Italtel.

Author: Lazarus Group (AKA HIDDEN COBRA)
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal that, as part of their "Operation Dreamjob" campaign, the North Korean 'Lazarus' group targeted employees of an aerospace company located in Spain with fake job opportunities to hack into the corporate network using a previously unknown 'LightlessCan' backdoor.
The FBI issues a public service announcement warning of a significant increase in 'phantom hacker' scams targeting senior citizens across the U.S.

Author: BunnyLoader
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a new malware-as-a-service (MaaS) named 'BunnyLoader' advertised on multiple hacker forums as a fileless loader that can steal and replace the contents of the system clipboard.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: McLaren HealthCare, confirms to be dealing with a ransomware after the BlackCat ransomware group takes credit for the incident. 2.5 million users are affected.

Author: APT34, AKA OilRig, Cobalt Gypsy, IRN2 and Helix Kitten
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new cyber espionage campaign by the Iranian threat actor APT34, infecting their victims with the newly discovered Menorah malware.
Researchers from Cyfirma observe threat actors exploiting the CVE-2023-34468 vulnerability, an RCE vulnerability exploiting Apache NiFi.
Cornerstone Home Lending files a notice of data breach after discovering that information provided to the company by consumers was subject to unauthorized access.
Classic Residence Management Limited Partnership d/b/a Vi Living files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to gain access to the company’s computer system.
Builders Mutual Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s computer network.
API Financial Solutions files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed the company’s computer network.
Mount Graham Regional Medical Center (MGRMC) files a notice of data breach after confirming a recent ransomware attack.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The pro-Russian collective NoName057(16) takes down the websites of the Italian Securities and Exchange Commission (CONSOB), Italian Association of Financial Intermediaries (ASSOSIM), Commissariat General for Market and Competition (AGCM), Italian National Association of Financial Planners (ANASF)

Target: Physio Logic Chiropractic and Physical Therapy, Physio Logic Medicine, and Dr. Patty DiBlasio
Description: Patients of Physio Logic Chiropractic and Physical Therapy, Physio Logic Medicine, and Dr. Patty DiBlasio have some of their protected health information exposed in a cyberattack

Target: Georgia Northside Ear, Nose, and Throat
Description: Georgia Northside Ear, Nose, and Throat files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information that had been entrusted to the company.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang adds the hotel chain Motel One to the list of victims.
Innovery, an Italian company delivering IT services, is hit with a cyber attack.
